<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	3
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Financial Instruments-risk management (continued)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Interest rate risk
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s interest rate risk arises
	from long-term borrowings issued at variable rates, which expose the Group to cash flow to interest rate risk.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group does not face interest rate risk
	on its US$ 300,000,000 Notes which carry a fixed rate coupon of 7.50% per annum. As consequence, the accruals and interest payment
	are no substantially affected to the market interest rate changes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At 31 December 2015 the outstanding long-term
	borrowing affected by variable rates amounted to US$ 76,178,000, representing 20% of total borrowings, which was composed by the loans from Ita&uacute; Bank and Banco de Chile
	that have a floating interest rate based on LIBOR.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group analyses its interest rate exposure
	on a dynamic basis. Various scenarios are simulated taking into consideration refinancing, renewal of existing positions, alternative
	financing and hedging. Based on these scenarios, the Group calculates the impact on profit and loss of a defined interest rate
	shift. For each simulation, the same interest rate shift is used for all currencies. The scenarios are run only for liabilities
	that represent the major interest-bearing positions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At 31 December 2015, if 1% is added to interest
	rates on currency-denominated borrowings with all other variables held constant, post-tax loss for the year would have been US$&nbsp;507,000
	higher (post-tax profit lower US$ 312,000 in 2014, nil in 2013).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Capital risk management
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s objectives when managing
	capital are to safeguard the Group&rsquo;s ability to continue as a going concern in order to provide returns for shareholders
	and benefits for other stakeholders and to maintain an optimal capital structure to reduce the cost of capital.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Consistent with others in the industry,
	the Group monitors capital on the basis of the gearing ratio. This ratio is calculated as net debt divided by total capital. Net
	debt is calculated as total borrowings (including &lsquo;current and non-current borrowings&rsquo; as shown in the consolidated
	balance sheet) less cash at bank and in hand. Total capital is calculated as &lsquo;equity&rsquo; as shown in the consolidated
	balance sheet plus net debt.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group&rsquo;s strategy is to keep the
	gearing ratio within a 30% to 45% range, in normal market conditions. Due to the market conditions prevailing during 2015 the gearing
	ratio at year end is above such range. Measures taken by the Company in this connection are described in Note 35.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 214 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: RGB(84,48,26) 1PT SOLID">

	F-

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	4
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Accounting estimates and assumptions
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Estimates and assumptions are used in preparing
	the financial statements. Although these estimates are based on management's best knowledge of current events and actions, actual
	results may differ from them. Estimates and judgements are continually evaluated and are based on historical experience and other
	factors, including expectations of future events that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The key estimates and assumptions used in
	these consolidated financial statements are noted below:&#9;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Cash
	flow estimates for impairment assessments require assumptions about two primary elements - future prices and reserves. Estimates
	of future prices require significant judgments about highly uncertain future events. Historically, oil and gas prices have exhibited
	significant volatility. The group&acute;s forecasts for oil and gas revenues are based on prices derived from future price forecasts
	amongst industry analysts and own assessments. Estimates of future cash flows are generally based on assumptions of long-term
	prices and operating and development costs.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Given the significant assumptions
	required and the possibility that actual conditions will differ, management considers the assessment of impairment to be a critical
	accounting estimate (see Notes 35 and 36).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The process of estimating reserves
	is complex. It requires significant judgements and decisions based on available geological, geophysical, engineering and economic
	data. The estimation of economically recoverable oil and natural gas reserves and related future net cash flows was performed based
	on the Reserve Report as of 31 December 2015 prepared by DeGolyer and MacNaughton, an international consultancy to the oil and
	gas industry based in Dallas. It incorporates many factors and assumptions including:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 215 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: RGB(84,48,26) 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	27
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>

<A HREF="#DP64464_20F_HTM_TOC" STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</P>
</DIV>

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	o
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	expected reservoir characteristics based on geological, geophysical and engineering assessments;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	o
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	future production rates based on historical performance and expected future operating and investment
	activities;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	o
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	future oil and gas prices and quality differentials;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	o
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	assumed effects of regulation by governmental agencies; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	o
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	future development and operating costs.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 35.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Management believes these factors
	and assumptions are reasonable based on the information available to them at the time of preparing the estimates. However, these
	estimates may change substantially as additional data from ongoing development activities and production performance becomes available
	and as economic conditions impacting oil and gas prices and costs change.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 35.45PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	The
	Group adopts the successful efforts method of accounting. The Management of the Company makes assessments and estimates regarding
	whether an exploration asset should continue to be carried forward as an exploration and evaluation asset not yet determined or
	when insufficient information exists for this type of cost to remain as an asset. In making this assessment the Management takes
	professional advice from qualified experts.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Oil
	and gas assets held in property plant and equipment are mainly depreciated on a unit of production basis at a rate calculated
	by reference to proven and probable reserves and incorporating the estimated future cost of developing and extracting those reserves.
	Future development costs are estimated using assumptions as to the numbers of wells required to produce those reserves, the cost
	of the wells and future production facilities.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 216 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: RGB(84,48,26) 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	28
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage217"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; FONT: BOLD 8PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<A HREF="#DP64464_20F_HTM_TOC" STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	4
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Accounting estimates and assumptions (continued)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Obligations
	related to the abandonment of wells once operations are terminated may result in the recognition of significant obligations. Estimating
	the future abandonment costs is difficult and requires management to make estimates and judgments because most of the obligations
	are many years in the future. Technologies and costs are constantly changing as well as political, environmental, safety and public
	relations considerations. The Company has adopted the following criterion for recognising well plugging and abandonment related
	costs: The present value of future costs necessary for well plugging and abandonment is calculated for each area on the basis
	of a cash flow that is discounted at an average interest rate applicable to Company&rsquo;s indebtedness. The liabilities recognised
	are based upon estimated future abandonment costs, wells subject to abandonment, time to abandonment, and future inflation rates.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	From
	time to time, the Company may be subject to various lawsuits, claims and proceedings that arise in the normal course of business,
	including employment, commercial, environmental, safety and health matters. For example, from time to time, the Company receives
	notice of environmental, health and safety violations. Based on what the Management of the Company currently knows, it is not
	expected any material impact on the financial statements.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	5
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Consolidated Statement of Cash Flow
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Consolidated Statement of Cash Flow
	shows the Group's cash flows for the year for operating, investing and financing activities and the change in cash and cash equivalents
	during the year.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Cash flows from operating activities are
	computed from the results for the year adjusted for non-cash operating items, changes in net working capital, and corporation tax.
	Tax paid is presented as a separate item under operating activities.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The following chart describes non-cash transactions
	related to the Consolidated Statement of Cash Flow:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Cash flows from investing activities include
	payments in connection with the purchase and sale of property, plant and equipment, cash flows relating to the purchase and sale
	of enterprises to third parties and cash flows from financial lease transactions. Cash flows from financing activities include changes in equity, and proceeds
	from borrowings and repayment of loans. Cash and cash equivalents include bank overdraft and liquid funds with a term of less than
	three months.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	6
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Segment information
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Operating segments are reported in a manner
	consistent with the internal reporting provided to the chief operating decision-maker. The chief operating decision-maker, who
	is responsible for allocating resources and assessing performance of the operating segments, has been identified as the Executive
	Committee. This committee is integrated by the CEO, COO, CFO and managers in charge of the Geoscience, Operations, Corporate Governance,
	Finance and People departments. This committee reviews the Group&rsquo;s internal reporting in order to assess performance and
	allocate resources. Management has determined the operating segments based on these reports.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The committee considers the business from
	a geographic perspective. As from 2015, the committee has changed the disclosure of certain elements of performance to be more
	comparable with other companies in the market and also to better follow up the performance of the business. This change impacts
	the segment information because gross profit or loss is no longer shown but no impact is generated in the measure of segment profit
	and loss.&#9;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	F-

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	6
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Segment information (continued)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Executive Committee assesses the performance
	of the operating segments based on a measure of Adjusted EBITDA. Adjusted EBITDA is defined as profit for the period before net
	finance cost, income tax, depreciation, amortization, certain non-cash items such as impairments and write-offs of unsuccessful
	efforts, accrual of share-based payment and other non recurring events. Operating Netback is equivalent to Adjusted EBITDA before
	cash expenses included in Administrative, Geological and Geophysical and Other operating expenses. Other information provided,
	except as noted below, to the Executive Committee is measured in a manner consistent with that in the financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Segment areas (geographical segments):
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Approximately 22% of capital expenditure
	was allocated to Chile (66% in 2014 and 63% in 2013), 66% was allocated to Colombia (29% in 2014 and 37% in 2013) and 12% was allocated
	to Brazil (5% in 2014, nil in 2013). The capital expenditure referred does not include total consideration for M&amp;A activities.
</P>

	&nbsp;

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17.85PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<SUP>
	(a)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Net of capitalised costs for oil stock included in Inventories.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<SUP>
	(b)
</SUP>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	In 2015 includes termination costs (see Note 36). Also includes internally
	capitalised costs.
</FONT>
</TD>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_79"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

	140,025
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<SUP>
	1
</SUP>
	Only 8,285 shares of the 83,882 shares paid as Director Fees were not issued during 2015 (see Note 29).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	Pedro Aylwin has a service contract that provides for him to act as Manager of Corporate Governance so he resigned his fees as
	Director.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">

</SUP>
	Technical Committee Chairman.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">

</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>

	5
</SUP>
	Nomination Committee Chairman.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<SUP>
	6
</SUP>
	Audit Committee Chairman until his resignation on 19 March 2015. Afterwards the Chairman is Robert Bedingfield.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<SUP>
	7
</SUP>
	On 10 December 2015, 123,839 shares were allocated to the payment of the Bonus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The non-executive Directors annual fees
	correspond to US$ 80,000 to be settled in cash and US$&nbsp;100,000 to be settled in stocks, paid quarterly in equal installments.
	In the event that a non-executive Director serves as Chairman of any Board Committees, an additional annual fee of US$ 20,000 shall
	apply. A Director who serves as a member of any Board Committees shall receive an annual fee of US$ 10,000. Total payment due shall
	be calculated in an aggregate basis for Directors serving in more than one Committee. The Chairman fee shall not be added to the
	member&acute;s fee for the same Committee. Payments of Chairmen and Committee members&acute; fees shall be made quarterly in arrears
	and settled in cash only.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During the first half of 2015, a decrease
	of 20% in the compensation program for the services of the non-executive Directors was approved.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #99CCFF 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	(3,112)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #99CCFF 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">

	(1,313)

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	15
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Tax reforms in Colombia and Chile
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Colombia
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	The Colombian Congress
	approved a Tax Reform in December 2014.&nbsp;This reform had introduced a temporary net wealth tax assessed on net equity&nbsp;on
	domestic and foreign legal entities, kept the rate of the income tax on equality (Enterprise contribution on equality, &ldquo;CREE&rdquo;
	for its Spanish acronym) at 9%, and applied a CREE surcharge until 2018, among other changes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	The net wealth
	tax (NWT)&nbsp;assessed on net equity applied for tax years 2015&nbsp;through 2017 for domestic and foreign&nbsp;entities that
	hold any wealth&nbsp;in Colombia, directly or&nbsp;indirectly, via permanent&nbsp;establishments (PEs) or&nbsp;branches. In the
	case of&nbsp;foreign or domestic&nbsp;individuals, the NWT would&nbsp;apply until 2018.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	NWT applied at progressive rates ranging&nbsp;from
	1.15% in 2014; 1% in 2015 and decreased to 0.4% in 2016 and finally would disappear in 2017,&nbsp;for corporate taxpayers.&nbsp;NWT
	paid is not deductible or creditable for Colombian income tax purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Reform also extended the current 9%
	CREE tax rate, which was&nbsp;scheduled to decrease to 8% in 2016. Also, it introduced a new CREE surcharge, beginning in 2015,
	from 5% in 2015, 6% in 2016, and 8% in 2017 to 9% in 2018. Therefore, the accumulated corporate income tax rate will rise to 43%
	in 2018. The Company considered the effects of this rate increase in the deferred income tax calculation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 225 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: RGB(84,48,26) 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	37
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage226"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT; FONT: BOLD 8PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<A HREF="#DP64464_20F_HTM_TOC" STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	15
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Tax reforms in Colombia and Chile (continued)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Colombia (continued)
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In addition, in December 2015, Colombia's
	government announced its plan for a tax reform to be submitted to Congress in March 2016. The main proposed changes included in
	the project are the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
	-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Unification between Income Tax and CREE, resulting in a &ldquo;new income tax&rdquo; with a rate between 30% and 35%;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
	-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Elimination of NWT;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
	-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Incorporation of dividend distribution withholding tax, with a rate between 10% and 15%;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
	-&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Increase of VAT rate from 16% to 19%
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	All these measures, if approved, will have
	effect for 2017 fiscal year onwards.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<U>
	Chile
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Chilean Congress approved a reform to
	the income tax law in September 2014. Under this reform the income tax rate increased from 20% in 2013 to 21% in 2014, 22.5% in
	2015, 24% in 2016, 25.5% in 2017 and 27% in 2018.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The operating subsidiaries that GeoPark
	controls in Chile, which are GeoPark TdF S.A., GeoPark Fell SpA and GeoPark Magallanes Limitada, are not affected by such income
	tax reform since they are covered by the tax treatment established in the Special contract of operations (&ldquo;CEOPs&rdquo;).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	16
</B>
</TD>

<B>
	Income tax
</B>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	16
</B>

<B>
	Income Tax (continued)
</B>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The tax on the Group&rsquo;s profit before
	tax differs from the theoretical amount that would arise using the weighted average tax rate applicable to profits of the consolidated
	entities as follows:
</P>

	and changes in the estimation of deferred tax assets and liabilities.

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Under current Bermuda law, the Company is
	not required to pay any taxes in Bermuda on income or capital gains. The Company has received an undertaking from the Minister
	of Finance in Bermuda that, in the event of any taxes being imposed, they will be exempt from taxation in Bermuda until March 2035.
	Income tax rates in those countries where the Group operates (Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Peru and Chile) ranges from 15%
	to 39%.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Group has significant tax losses available
	which can be utilised against future taxable profit in the following countries:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At the balance sheet date deferred tax assets
	in respect of tax losses in Argentina and in certain Companies in Chile have not been recognised as there is insufficient evidence
	of future taxable profits before the statute of limitation of these tax losses causes them to expire.
</P>

</TD>

</TABLE>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

<B>
	Property, plant and equipment (continued)
</B>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<SUP>
	(*)
</SUP>
	During 2013, the Company
	entered into a finance lease for which it has transferred a substantial portion of the risk and rewards of some assets which had
	a book value of US$ 14,100,000. In 2014, the finance lease finalized when the purchase option on the assets subject to the agreement
	was exercised by the lessee.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<SUP>
	(1)
</SUP>
	Corresponds to the effect
	of change in estimate of assets retirement obligations in Colombia.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<SUP>
	(2)
</SUP>
	Exploration wells
	movement and balances are shown in the table below; seismic and other exploratory assets amount to US$ 64,094,000 (US$
	99,939,000 in 2014 and US$ 117,841,000 in 2013).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As of 31 December 2015, there were
	seven exploratory wells that have been capitalised for a period over a year amounting to US$ 19,273,000 and three
	exploratory wells that have been capitalised for a period less than a year amounting to US$ 3,633,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<SUP>
	(a)
</SUP>
	Corresponds to the cost of
	five unsuccessful exploratory wells: two of them in Chile (one in Fell Block and one in Tranquilo Block) and three of them in Colombia
	(one well in Cuerva Block, one well in each of the non-operated blocks, Arrendajo and Llanos 32).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<SUP>
	(b)
</SUP>
	Corresponds to the cost of
	ten unsuccessful exploratory wells: eight of them in Chile (three in Flamenco Block, two in Fell Block, two in Tranquilo Block
	and one in Campanario Block) and two of them in Colombia (two in the non-operated Arrendajo Block). The charge also includes the
	loss generated by the write-off of the remaining seismic cost for Otway and Tranquilo Blocks, registered in previous years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<SUP>
	(c)
</SUP>
	Corresponds to the cost of
	two unsuccessful exploratory wells in Colombia (one well in CPO4 Block and one well in Llanos 32). The charge also includes the
	loss generated by the write-off of the seismic cost for Flamenco Block in Chile generated by the relinquishment of 143 sq km in
	November 2015 and the write off of two wells drilled in previous years in the same block for which no additional work would be
	performed.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>

	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	43

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Trade receivables that are aged by less
	than three months are not considered impaired. As of 31 December 2015, trade receivables of US$ 51,000 (US$ 6,092 in 2014) were
	aged by more than 3 months, but not impaired. These relate to customers for whom there is no recent history of default. There are
	no balances due between 31 days and 90 days as of 31 December 2015 and 2014.
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The credit period for trade receivables
	is 30 days. The maximum exposure to credit risk at the reporting date is the carrying value of each class of receivable. The Group
	does not hold any collateral as security related to trade receivables.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The carrying value of trade receivables
	is considered to represent a reasonable approximation of its fair value due to their short-term nature.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	The remaining balance sheet
	item &lsquo;cash at bank and in hand&rsquo; corresponds to cash on hand amounting to US$&nbsp;10,000 (US$ 112,000 in 2014).

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	25
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Share capital (continued)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Stock Award Program and Other Share Based
	Payments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On 29 October 2013, the Company put into
	place an irrevocable, non-discretionary share purchase program for the purchase of its common shares for the account of the EBT.
	This Purchase Program expired on 31 December 2013. The common shares purchased under the program will be used to satisfy future
	awards under the incentive schemes. During 2013, the Company purchased 50,000 common shares for a total amount of US$ 440,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Under the stock awards programs and other
	share based payments, during 2013, 60,000 new common shares were issued, pursuant to a consulting agreement for services rendered
	to GeoPark Limited generating a share premium of US$ 506,630.&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On 12 November 2015 and 22 December 2015,
	817,600 and 478,000 common shares were allotted to the trustee of the Employee Beneficiary Trust (&ldquo;EBT&rdquo;), generating
	a share premium of US$ 11,359,000 and US$ 3,577,000, respectively. On 17 September 2013, 295,599 common shares were allotted to
	the trustee of the EBT, generating a share premium of US$ 3,441,689.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On 30 November 2015 720,000 new common shares
	were issued to the Executive Directors, generating a share premium of US$ 7,309,000.&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During 2015, the Company issued 99,555 (2,301
	in 2014 and 10,430 in 2013) shares to Non-Executive Directors in accordance with contracts as compensation, generating a share
	premium of US$ 486,692 (US$ 22,413 in 2014 and US$ 100,988 in 2013). The amount of shares issued is determined considering the
	contractual compensation and the fair value of the shares for each relevant period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	IPO
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On 7 February 2014, the SEC declared effective
	the Company&rsquo;s registration statement upon which 13,999,700 shares were issued at a price of US$ 7 per share, including over-allotment
	option. Gross proceeds from the offering totalled US$ 98,000,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Buyback Program
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On 19 December 2014, the Company
	approved a program to repurchase up to US$ 10,000,000 of common shares, par value US$ 0.001 per share of the Company (the
	&ldquo;Repurchase Program&rdquo;). The Repurchase Program began on 19 December 2014 and was resumed on 14 April 2015 and then
	on 10 June 2015, expiring on 18 August 2015. The Shares repurchased will be used to offset, in part, any expected dilution
	effects resulting from the Company&rsquo;s employee incentive schemes, including grants under the Company&rsquo;s Stock Award
	Plan and the Limited Non-Executive Director Plan. During 2015 and 2014, the Company purchased 370,074 and 73,082 common
	shares for a total amount of US$ 1,615,000 and US$ 388,000, respectively. These transactions had no impact on the
	Company&rsquo;s results.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fair value of these financial instruments
	at 31 December 2015 amounts to US$ 352,410,000 (US$ 360,181,000 in 2014). The fair values are based on cash flows discounted using a rate based on the borrowing rate of 7.51%
	(2014: 7.40%) and are within level 2 of the fair value hierarchy.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	(a) During February 2013, the Company successfully
	placed US$ 300,000,000 notes which were offered under Rule 144A and Regulation S exemptions of the United States Securities laws.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Notes, issued by the Company's wholly-owned
	subsidiary GeoPark Latin America Limited Agencia en Chile (&quot;the Issuer&quot;), were priced at 99.332% and carry a coupon of
	7.50% per annum (yield 7.625% per annum). Final maturity of the notes will be 11 February 2020. The Notes are guaranteed by GeoPark
	Limited and GeoPark Latin America Cooperatie U.A. and are secured with a pledge of all of the equity interests of the Issuer in
	GeoPark Chile S.A. and GeoPark Colombia S.A. and a pledge of certain intercompany loans. The debt issuance cost for this transaction
	amounted to US$ 7,637,000. The indenture governing our Notes due 2020 includes incurrence test covenants that provides among other
	things, that, the Debt to EBITDA ratio should not exceed 2.5 times and the EBITDA to Interest ratio should exceed 3.5 times. As
	of the date of these consolidated financial statements, the Company&rsquo;s Debt to EBITDA ratio was 5.1 times and the EBITDA to
	Interest ratio was 2.4 times, primarily due to the lower oil prices that impacted the Company&rsquo;s EBITDA generation. Failure
	to comply with the incurrence test covenants does not trigger an event of default. However, this situation may limit the Company&rsquo;s
	capacity to incur additional indebtedness, as specified in the indenture governing the Notes. Incurrence covenants as opposed to
	maintenance covenants must be tested by the Company before incurring additional debt or performing certain corporate actions including
	but not limited to dividend payments, restricted payments and others, (other than in each case, certain specific exceptions). As
	of the date of these consolidated financial statements, the Company is in compliance of all the indenture&rsquo;s provisions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 240 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: RGB(84,48,26) 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-

</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	26
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Borrowings (continued)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	(b) During March 2014, GeoPark executed
	a loan agreement with Ita&uacute; BBA International for US$&nbsp;70,450,000 to finance the acquisition of a 10% working interest
	in the Manat&iacute; field in Brazil. The interest rate applicable to this loan is LIBOR plus 3.9% per annum. The interest will
	be paid semi-annually; principal will be cancelled semi-annually with a year grace period. The debt issuance cost for this transaction
	amounted to US$ 3,295,000. The facility agreement includes customary events of default, and requires the Brazilian subsidiary to
	comply with customary covenants, including the maintenance of a ratio of net debt to EBITDA of up to 3.5x for the first two years
	and up to 3.0x thereafter. The credit facility also limits the borrower&rsquo;s ability to pay dividends if the ratio of net debt
	to EBITDA is greater than 2.5x. As of the date of these consolidated financial statements, the Company has complied with these
	covenants.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In March 2015, the Company reached an agreement
	to: (i) extend the principal payments that were due in 2015 (amounting to approximately US$ 15,000,000), which will be divided
	pro-rata during the remaining principal installments, starting in March 2016 and (ii) increase the variable interest rate to six-month
	LIBOR + 4.0%.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	(c) During October 2007, GeoPark executed
	a mortgage loan agreement with Banco de Cr&eacute;dito e Inversiones (BCI), a Chilean private bank, for the acquisition of the
	operational base in Fell Block. The loan was granted in Chilean pesos and is repayable over a period of 8 years. The interest rate
	applicable to this loan is 6.6%. The mortgage loan was fully repaid on October 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	(d) During December 2015, GeoPark executed
	a loan agreement with Banco de Chile for US$&nbsp;7,028,000 to finance the start-up of new Ache gas field in GeoPark-operated Fell
	Block. The interest rate applicable to this loan is LIBOR plus 2.35% per annum. The interest and the principal will be paid on
	monthly basis; with a six months grace period, with final maturity on December 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As of the date of these consolidated financial
	statements, the Group has available credit lines for over US$ 37,000,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #3366FF">
<B>
	Deferred
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The provision for asset retirement obligation
	relates to the estimation of future disbursements related to the abandonment and decommissioning of oil and gas wells (see Note
	4).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Deferred income relates to contributions
	received to improve the project economics of the gas wells. The amortisation is in line with the related asset.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Other mainly relates to fiscal controversies
	associated to income taxes in one of the Colombian subsidiaries. These controversies relate to fiscal periods prior to the acquisition
	of these subsidiaries by the Company. In connection to this, the Company has recorded an account receivable for an amount of US$
	5,636,000, with the previous owners for the same amount, which is recognized under other financial assets in the balance sheet.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>

<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	The outstanding amount corresponds
	to a loan granted by LGI to GeoPark Chile S.A. for financing Chilean operations in TdF&rsquo;s blocks. The maturity of this loan
	is July 2020 and the applicable interest rate is 8% per annum.
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT: 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The average credit period (expressed as
	creditor days) during the year ended 31 December 2015 was 38 days (2014: 50 days)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fair value of these short-term financial
	instruments is not individually determined as the carrying amount is a reasonable approximation of fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	Note
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	29
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Share-based payment
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	IPO Award Program and Executive Stock
	Option plan
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group has established different stock
	awards programs and other share-based payment plans to incentivise the Directors, senior management and employees, enabling them
	to benefit from the increased market capitalization of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Stock Award Program and Other Share Based
	Payments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During 2008, GeoPark Shareholders voted
	to authorize the Board to use up to 12% of the issued share capital of the Company at the relevant time for the purposes of the
	Performance-based Employee Long-Term Incentive Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Main characteristics of the Stock Awards
	Programs are:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TD>

</FONT>
</TD>

	All employees are eligible.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; PADDING-TOP: 1.5; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.5">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Specific Award amounts are reviewed and
	approved by the Executive Directors and the Remuneration Committee of the Board of Directors.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On 23 November&nbsp;2012, the Remuneration
	Committee and the Board of Directors approved granting 720,000 options over ordinary shares of US$0.001 each to the Executive Directors.
	Options granted vest on the third anniversary of the date on which they are granted and have an exercise price of US$0.001. On
	30 November 2015, the options were exercised and the shares were issued.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Additionally, during 2013 the Company approved
	two new share-based compensation programs: i.) a stock awards plan oriented to Managers (non-Top Management) and key employees
	who qualifies as an equity-settled plan and ii.) a cash awards plan, oriented to all non-management employees which qualifies as
	a cash-settled plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Main characteristics of these news plans are:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Also during 2013, the Company approved a
	plan named Value Creation Plan (&ldquo;VCP&rdquo;) oriented to Top Management. The VCP establishes awards payables in a variable
	number of shares with some limitation, subject to certain market conditions, among others, reach certain stock market price for
	the Company share at vesting date. VCP has been classified as an equity-settled plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	29
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Share-based payment (continued)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On 10 December 2015, after full discussion
	by the Compensation Committee regarding programs&acute; conditions, the Committee confirmed conditions will not be archived (mainly
	impacted by oil international prices) to execute these programs.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On 19 December 2014, the Company has approved
	a new share-based compensation program for 500,000 shares oriented to new employees. This new program, which was granted on 31
	December 2014, has a vesting period of three years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Details of these costs and the characteristics
	of the different stock awards programs and other share based payments are described in the following table and explanations:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	The awards that are forfeited correspond
	to employees that had left the Group before vesting date, except for the ones related to the 2013 program that are forfeited because
	the conditions were not achieved.

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	Note
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	30
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	Interests in Joint operations
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Group has interests in nine joint operations,
	which are engaged in the exploration of hydrocarbons in Chile, Colombia and Brazil.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	In Chile, GeoPark is the operator in all the
	blocks. In Colombia, GeoPark is the operator in Llanos 34 and Yamu/Carupana blocks.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The following amounts represent the Company&rsquo;s
	share in the assets, liabilities and results of the joint operations which have been consolidated line by line in the consolidated
	statement of financial position and statement of income:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="2" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	Subsidiary
	/
</B>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; COLOR: #3366FF">
</P>

	&nbsp;

</TD>

	Interest
</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; COLOR: #3366FF">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<B>
	E&amp;E
